tool.name: Manta
tool.description: Manta calls structural variants (SVs) and indels from mapped paired-end sequencing reads.

param.name: bam_input_selector
param.label: Single 'normal' or 'normal vs tumor' analysis
param.help: Select between a single normal BAM file or a pair of normal/tumor BAM files

param.name: normal_bam_file
param.label: select normal BAM
param.help: Select the files you wish to send to Manta (normal sample, it must be in BAM format).

param.name: normal_bam_file
param.label: select normal BAM
param.help: Select the files you wish to send to Manta (normal sample, it must be in BAM format).

param.name: tumor_bam_file
param.label: select tumor BAM
param.help: Select the files you wish to send to Manta (tumor sample, it must be in BAM format).

param.name: additional_param
param.label: Additional parameters
param.option: Set options for WES input: turn off depth filters
Set options for RNA-Seq input. Must specify exactly one bam input file
Set if RNA-Seq input is unstranded: Allows splice-junctions on either strand

param.name: callMemMb
param.label: Set default task memory requirements
param.help: The maximum memory size to assign to tasks

param.name: scanSizeMb
param.label: Set maximum sequence region size
param.help: The maximum sequence region size (in megabases) scanned by each task during SV Locus graph generation. (default: 12)

param.name: set_configuration_switch
param.label: Do you want to change default configuration settings?
param.option: Customize a Configuration File using this Galaxy Form

param.name: minCandidateVariantSize
param.label: minCandidateVariantSize
param.help: Run discovery and candidate reporting for all SVs/indels at or above this size.

param.name: rnaMinCandidateVariantSize
param.label: rnaMinCandidateVariantSize
param.help: Separate option (to provide different default) used for runs in RNA-mode.

param.name: minEdgeObservations
param.label: minEdgeObservations
param.help: Remove all edges from the graph unless they're supported by this many 'observations'.

param.name: graphNodeMaxEdgeCount
param.label: graphNodeMaxEdgeCount
param.help: If both nodes of an edge have an edge count higher than this, then skip evaluation of the edge.

param.name: minCandidateSpanningCount
param.label: minCandidateSpanningCount
param.help: Run discovery and candidate reporting for all SVs/indels with at least this many spanning support observations.

param.name: minScoredVariantSize
param.label: minScoredVariantSize

param.name: minDiploidVariantScore
param.label: minDiploidVariantScore

param.name: minPassDiploidVariantScore
param.label: minPassDiploidVariantScore
param.help: VCF 'QUAL' score below which a variant is marked as filtered in the diploid vcf.

param.name: minPassDiploidGTScore
param.label: minPassDiploidGTScore
param.help: Minimum genotype quality score below which single samples are filtered for a variant in the diploid vcf.

param.name: minSomaticScore
param.label: minSomaticScore
param.help: Somatic quality scores below this level are not included in the somatic vcf.

param.name: minPassSomaticScore
param.label: minPassSomaticScore
param.help: Somatic quality scores below this level are filtered in the somatic vcf.

param.name: enableRemoteReadRetrievalForInsertionsInGermlineCallingModes
param.label: enableRemoteReadRetrievalForInsertionsInGermlineCallingModes
param.help: Remote read retrieval is used ot improve the assembly of putative insertions by retrieving any mate reads in remote locations with poor mapping quality. This feature can be enabled/disabled separately for germline and cancer calling below.

param.name: enableRemoteReadRetrievalForInsertionsInCancerCallingModes
param.label: enableRemoteReadRetrievalForInsertionsInCancerCallingModes
param.help: Here 'CancerCallingModes' includes tumor-normal subtraction and tumor-only calling. 'GermlineCallingModes' includes all other calling modes.

param.name: useOverlapPairEvidence
param.label: useOverlapPairEvidence
param.help: Set if an overlapping read pair will be considered as evidence. Set this value <= 0 to skip overlapping read pairs.

param.label: Unfiltered structural variants
param.help: All unscored structural variant candidates

param.label: Unfiltered small indel candidates
param.help: Subset of the unscored candidates, containing only small indel variants

param.label: Score-filtered variants in diploid model
param.help: Show filtered variants in a diploid (only normal) model. In the case of a tumor/normal subtraction, the scores in this file *do not* reflect any information from the tumor sample

tool.help:
**Outputs** The primary Manta outputs are a set of VCF 4.1 files. Currently there are 3 VCF files created for a germline analysis, and an additional somatic VCF is produced for a tumor/normal subtraction. These files are:
- diploidSV.vcf.gz SVs and indels scored and genotyped under a diploid model for the set of samples in a joint diploid sample analysis or for the normal sample in a tumor/normal subtraction analysis. **In the case of a tumor/normal subtraction, the scores in this file do not reflect any information from the tumor sample.**
- somaticSV.vcf.gz SVs and indels scored under a somatic variant model. This file will only be produced if a tumor sample alignment file is supplied during configuration
- candidateSV.vcf.gz Unscored SV and indel candidates. Only a minimal amount of supporting evidence is required for an SV to be entered as a candidate in this file. An SV or indel must be a candidate to be considered for scoring, therefore an SV cannot appear in the other VCF outputs if it is not present in this file. Note that by default this file includes indels of size 8 and larger. The smallest indels in this set are intended to be passed on to a small variant caller without scoring by manta itself (by default manta scoring starts at size 50).
- candidateSmallIndels.vcf.gz Subset of the candidateSV.vcf.gz file containing only simple insertion and deletion variants less than the minimum scored variant size (50 by default). Passing this file to a small variant caller will provide continuous coverage over all indel sizes when the small variant caller and manta outputs are evaluated together. Alternate small indel candidate sets can be parsed out of the candidateSV.vcf.gz file if this candidate set is not appropriate.
For tumor-only analysis, Manta will produce an additional VCF:
- tumorSV.vcf.gz Subset of the candidateSV.vcf.gz file after removing redundant candidates and small indels less than the minimum scored variant size (50 by default). The SVs are not scored, but include additional details: (1) paired and split read supporting evidence counts for each allele (2) a subset of the filters from the scored tumor-normal model are applied to the single tumor case to improve precision.
**Manta helps** This script configures the Manta SV analysis pipeline. You must specify a BAM or CRAM file for at least one sample. Configuration will produce a workflow run script which can execute the workflow on a single node or through sge and resume any interrupted execution.
For further info see: https://github.com/Illumina/manta
